title: Open Technology Research Officially Launches to Strengthen Global Research Community
content: Brussels, February 2026 – OpenForum Europe (OFE), the Open Source Initiative (OSI), and the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKFN) announced last Friday, 30 January at the EU Open Source Policy Summit the official launch of Open Technology Research (OTR) — a strategic partnership designed to strengthen the global open technology research community and advance evidence-based policymaking around open technologies. title: OpenForum Europe Appoints Laszlo Igneczi as Executive Director
content: OFE Open Source Policy Summit 2026, Brussels – 31 January 2026 OpenForum Europe (OFE) is pleased to announce the appointment of Laszlo Igneczi as its new Executive Director. The announcement marks the start of a new chapter for the organisation as it enters its twenty-fourth year of championing the transformative power of open technologies. Laszlo brings three decades of experience spanning EU institutions, national ministries and the private sector to OFE. His career has combined in-depth polic...

title: Open technologies, public procurement and economic impact: lessons from Denmark for Europe’s next digital laws
content: Europe’s debate on cloud, artificial intelligence and digital sovereignty often assumes a trade-off between competitiveness, control, and cost. Evidence from public-sector procurement suggests the opposite. When governments use their purchasing power to create sustained demand for open source technologies, supported by appropriate institutional capacity, they can strengthen domestic digital ecosystems and economic growth, improve procurement outcomes and reduce strategic dependency at the same t...

title: OFE’s Public Letter Calls on the EU to Invest in Sovereign Tech Fund
content: Today, a new coalition of industry leaders, open source companies, and civil society has come together with OpenForum Europe to urge the EU to invest a minimum of €350 million to maintain critical open source software underpinning Europe’s digital infrastructure. Initiated by OpenForum Europe, dozens of organisations have signed a Public Letter calling specifically for the establishment of an EU Sovereign Tech Fund (EU-STF) to address the chronic under-investment in open source software ma...

title: OFE Landmark Study Urges EU to Invest in Open Digital Infrastructure
content: OpenForum Europe (OFE) has released its much-anticipated report, Funding Europe’s Open Digital Infrastructure: A Study on the Economic, Legal, and Political Feasibility of an EU Sovereign Tech Fund (EU-STF) . Developed in collaboration with Fraunhofer ISI and the European University Institute , the study makes a forceful case for a mission-driven, EU-wide investment vehicle to address systemic underfunding of the open digital infrastructure Europe depends on.
